revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=TOTOLINK |model=A810R |revision= |series=AC1200 |asin= |fcc_date=03/22/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Zioncom |manuf_model=IP04347 |type=wireless router |fcc_id=X7DIP04347 |pcb_id=2058139C |pwr_v=9 |pwr_amp=0.8 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8197FNT;RTL8197FNT, H4F84P2 GH18E4; |cpu1_cspeed=600 |fla1=8 |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Realtek |ram1_model=RTL8197FNT |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8197FNT;RTL8197FNT, H4F84P2 GH18E4; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi2_chip1_model=RTL8812BR;RTL8812BRH, H8T37E1 GH38N; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=2 |wan_ports=1 |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin }}
:• '''867''' Mbps - 2SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''300''' Mbps - 2SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan.) = '''''1200 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|AC1200 Wireless Dual Band Router}} :{{ProductPage|http://www.totolink.net/sub/product/detail.asp?product_num=100178}} "2058139C" is silkscreened on the back of the board in the FCC photos. A [https://fccid.io/X7DIP04347/Letter/Declaration-of-Similarity-3792018 Declaration of Similarity] document at the FCC says that :the [[Zioncom]] IP04347 is electrically identical to the A810R. The [https://fccid.io/X7DIP04347/Test-Report/Test-report-3792012 Test report] for 2.4 GHz document says, :"The device has 3 external antennas for 2.4GHz and 2 external antennas for 5GHz. :For 2.4GHz band, the device supports 2T3R, and 11 channels are provided:" The Datasheet provided by TOTOLINK says that the processor is 600MHz so maybe :the RTL8197FNT is clocked slower than the RTL8197FN which is supposedly 1GHz. The 64MB RAM number is a guess based on the specs listed for the Yuncore TDMA :[http://www.internetwifiaccesspoint.com/quality-10056589-tdma-300mbps100mw-outdoor-wifi-client 300Mbps100mW Outdoor Wifi Client] which also supposedly has a RTL8197FNT. The RTL8197FN* series is known to have varying amounts of on-chip RAM.
